name: Template Design – CR1
content: Introduce a load-balancing constraint requiring that no template may be used disproportionately more than others. Specifically, for an integer ratio (alpha_num / alpha_den) >= 1, the production of any template must not exceed (alpha_num / alpha_den) times the production of any other template.
value_info:
`n_slots`: Number of slots available on each template.
`n_templates`: Number of templates.
`n_var`: Number of product variations.
`demand`: List of integers of size n_var representing required demand for each variation.
`alpha_num`: An integer numerator of the load-balance ratio.
`alpha_den`: An integer denominator (must be > 0). The ratio alpha_num/alpha_den must be >= 1.

var1.descr: `production`: A list of integers of length n_templates giving the number of times each template is used.

var2.descr: `layout`: A 2D list of shape [n_templates × n_var] showing slot allocations.
